text: hi guys it's Jilly today we'll be making
probably the best cheesecake I've ever
made
salted caramel cheesecake it's
incredible you definitely need to make
this for Thanksgiving Black Friday
Saturday whatever comes quicker because
it's so good so let's get started okay
so you're going to need an 8-inch
springform pan I wrapped it in some
aluminum foil because we'll be preparing
a water bath later on and the aluminum
foil will prevent the water from getting
in here have some crushed graham
crackers with some unsalted melted
butter I just mixed some unsalted melted
butter and the crushed graham cracker is
until it resembled what's and I use my
fingers to press it down onto the
springform pan and I went up the size
just a little bit I then placed this in
the fridge
I turned the oven on to 325 degrees and
I then got started on the cheesecake
filling you're going to need some
softened cream cheese the cream cheese
will be the star so I would suggest
using a very good creamy cream cheese go
ahead and mix that I'm using three
blocks of cream cheese so that's 24
ounces and you want to mix that until
it's nice and smooth go ahead and add
the sour cream sour cream is super rich
but we want this cheesecake to be very
delicious creamy and rich we're not
making this every day so let's
definitely splurge here full-fat
everything go ahead and add a little bit
of vanilla extract and then your sugar
once the sugar is well incorporated we
are going to add the eggs three eggs
total one by one and once you're done
adding the eggs you want to mix it for
an additional 5 to 10 seconds and that's
it you definitely do not want to over
mix this let's pour the cheesecake
filling into the springform pan and
we're then going to bake it for about an
hour and 15 minutes if you do not want
to see any cracks on your cheesecake and
you want it to bake smoothly you'll need
to place the springform pan in a larger
oven safe baking dish add some boiling
water to the baking dish and then bake
it I have the complete recipe and
instructions over on my website cooked
by Julie comm and I promise you you will
have the most rich and creamy crack list
cheesecake ever so to make the caramel
sauce here
going to need some sugar and water cook
that over a medium-high heat to not stir
it with a spoon just move your saucepan
around and that'll do the job definitely
keep your eye on it sugar burns
extremely quickly the minute you see it
turn into a nice golden color like this
turn off the heat and you want to add
the butter and heavy cream right away
stir it in and then you are going to let
it thicken nicely so it will start
bubbling and you just want to keep on
stirring my cheesecake was in the fridge
overnight but you may do for hours
definitely needs to refrigerate for a
minimum of four hours this cheesecake
was perfect
it never cracks because I always follow
the exact method and it isn't difficult
at all it did have a little bit of air
bubbles but that's quite all right you
just have to like really shake off the
air bubbles once you place the filling
into the springform pan and I was
supposed to smooth it out just a little
bit more but that's all right now
you want to pour the caramel sauce once
it's completely cooled because if not
your your cheesecake will probably melt
and I poured that delicious waterfall of
caramel over the cheesecake or should I
say caramel fall and I then sprinkled
some salt over it
now you may do two things you may salt
your caramel you may add about 1/4
teaspoon directly to the caramel or you
may just sprinkle some salt on top of
the caramel I would suggest using some
kosher or some sea salt you definitely
want it to be a coarse salt and this was
I promise you the most incredible
cheesecake ever I want you to make this
this weekend just to try it and make
sure it tastes good and then make it
again for Thanksgiving because your
guests will be blown away I hope you
guys enjoyed this video and I want to
thank you all so much for watching
